str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Tomorrow. From epi and aurion; occurring on the succeeding day, i.e. to-morrow.

str2: To will, intend, desire, wish. Middle voice of a primary verb; to 'will, ' i.e. be willing.

(lit: unfailing), safe, reliable, trustworthy, certain, sure. Secure.

str2: To accuse, charge, prosecute. From kategoros; to be a plaintiff, i.e. To charge with some offence.
A primary preposition; under, i.e. of place, or with verbs; of place (underneath) or where (below) or time (when).

Jewish. From Iouda; Judaean, i.e. Belonging to Jehudah.

str2: A primary verb; to 'loosen'.

str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
And, even, also, namely.

str2: To command, order, direct, bid. From a primary kello; 'hail'; to incite by word, i.e. Order.

High priest, chief priest. From arche and hiereus; the high-priest; by extension a chief priest.

str2: From kata and ago; to lead down; specially, to moor a vessel.
